project.heading: New In-tend Website
project.summary: In-Tend is a software provider specialising in e-procurement solutions used by universities, governments, and large organisations. I worked with their team to redesign and modernise their marketing website, creating a more intuitive and professional digital presence that reflects the quality of their platform. My role combined UX design, prototyping, and front-end development, translating user flows into polished, production-ready pages.
project.challenge:
The existing website had grown outdated, with inconsistent design patterns and limited responsiveness across devices. The challenge was to:

  • Unify the brand identity across pages and sections.
  • Create a modern, mobile-friendly experience that would appeal to enterprise buyers.
  • Introduce a flexible design system to scale future content and campaigns.
  • Ensure the site was accessible and performant, meeting WCAG standards and loading quickly.
project.approach:
I approached the project as both a designer and front-end engineer:

  • Prototyping & UX: Created wireframes and interactive prototypes to refine page layouts and user journeys.
  • Design system: Defined reusable components (buttons, cards, forms, navigation) in Figma, later implemented in code.
  • Front-end build: Delivered responsive, semantic HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript templates, focusing on accessibility, performance, and maintainability.
  • Collaboration: Worked in sprints with In-Tend’s internal team, iterating quickly and validating design decisions with stakeholders.
project.outcomes:
The new In-Tend website launched with:

  • A clean, modern interface that better communicates trust and professionalism.
  • Consistent design patterns through a lightweight design system.
  • Fully responsive templates optimised for mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  • Improved accessibility and Core Web Vitals performance, creating a smoother experience for users.
  • A flexible foundation that allows In-Tend’s team to extend and maintain the site more easily.
project.why: The redesign not only refreshed In-Tend’s online presence but also delivered a scalable framework for future growth. By bridging design thinking with front-end execution, I helped their team reduce inconsistencies, improve usability, and ensure the website reflects the reliability of their e-procurement products.
